application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA
description:
People Ops is always looking to make the experience of work better and more meaningful for Googlers. But innovating (and operating!) is increasingly complex when Googlers work in more than 50 countries, each with its own unique practices and regulations. The Diversity, Integrity & Governance team works to make sure we not only do what’s required by law, but that we continue to raise the bar and do what’s right for Googlers all over the globe. From supporting LGBT rights to extending parental leave benefits, we aspire to do the right thing in every part of the world: to be fair and inclusive, disciplined but not rigid, and consistent but not bureaucratic.

The Strategy, Communications, Outreach, Policy and Engagement (SCOPE) team works closely with the Employee Engagement (EE) Leadership team to help define and articulate Google’s overarching Diversity, equity, and inclusiveness (DEI) strategy. The SCOPE team works holistically and cross-functionally across many areas, and as Diversity Strategy Manager, you'll partner with the EE team and other internal and external stakeholders.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in consulting, strategy, operations, organizational change/change management, program management, diversity, equity and inclusion and/or a related field.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Project management experience.
  • Proven ability to build sustainable relationships with key stakeholders across the organization.
  • Ability to articulate a vision to teams across the organization and business, with excellent creative thinking skills.
responsibilities:
• Lead the ideation, creation, and execution of the Diversity Annual Report and all associated deliverables. Develop the long-term roadmap to articulate annual iterations leading to expanding narrative scope, increased data transparency, and concrete examples of action.
  • Work in close partnership with Employee Engagement Leads on systems mapping, partner across teams to create the annual plan, objectives, leverage points and OKRs.
  • Operationalize strategy through systems and tools to achieve scale, lead key stakeholders through change management.
  • Conduct needs assessments and external partnerships gap analysis, make recommendations on core external stakeholders, value proposition and cadence of engagement, align across internal teams.
  • Develop internal and external communications to articulate our new strategy, deliver stakeholder communications to secure buy-in, partner with cross-functional teams to pitch and place new opportunities for DEI stories, and manage the delivery of messaging.
title: Diversity Strategy Manager
